data.title: All 104 Pierce Brosnan Movies (in Order)
data.meta_description: Get ready to dive into the world of Pierce Brosnan with our latest movie roundup article! From his iconic James Bond role to his diverse range of films, we’ll be exploring the many sides of this…
data.text:
Donna Frye

·

Follow

39 min read

·

Mar 17, 2024

--

Get ready to dive into the world of Pierce Brosnan with our latest movie roundup article! From his iconic James Bond role to his diverse range of films, we’ll be exploring the many sides of this talented actor. Join us as we take a closer look at Pierce Brosnan’s impressive filmography and what makes him one of Hollywood’s most beloved stars.

1. The Long Good Friday (1980)

The Long Good Friday (1980) takes us on a tense journey into the underworld of London’s crime scene, as we follow the story of an ambitious and cunning gangster, whose world gets turned upside down by an unknown, extremely powerful force.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

2. Murphy’s Stroke (1980)

In the thrilling drama of “Murphy’s Stroke” (1980), a group of Irish millionaires concoct an elaborate betting scam, setting their sights on a lucrative prize at an English horse race. This cunning operation, led by the con man Murphy, involves assembling a team of skilled individuals, each with a unique talent. As they embark on their daring plan, the stakes are high, and the tension mounts.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

3. The Mirror Crack’d (1980)

The Mirror Crack’d, “ a 1980 mystery thriller, transports audiences to the quiet village of St. Mary Mead, where a deadly poisoning takes place.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

4. Night of 100 Stars II (1985)

Step into a world of glamour, laughter, and song! . “Night of 100 Stars II” is a 1985 television special that combines the genres of comedy, family, and music. An impressive array of stars, including Debbie Allen, Peter Allen, and Harry Anderson, come together in this heartwarming celebration of entertainment.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

5. NBC 60th Anniversary Celebration (1986)

Celebrate the rich history of NBC with an extraordinary retrospective! . In 1986, the network hosted a special anniversary event highlighting the evolution of television over the past 60 years, capturing the reminiscences of stars and pioneers alike. This captivating documentary features renowned personalities like Debbie Allen, Steve Allen, and Fran Allison, as they share their experiences and fondest memories of their time with the network.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

6. Nomads (1986)

Nomads (1986), directed by John McTiernan, is a mesmerizing blend of horror, mystery, and thriller that takes the audience on a chilling journey. The film follows a French anthropologist and his wife as they relocate to Los Angeles, where their lives intertwine with a disconcerting group of nomadic street punks operating in a mysterious black van.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

7. The Fourth Protocol (1987)

In the gripping 1987 thriller, The Fourth Protocol, seasoned British agent John Preston is on a high-stakes mission to prevent a chilling Russian plot. With the tension between the former Cold War rivals reaching a boiling point, the Russians plan to detonate a devastating nuclear explosion near an American base in the UK. Their ultimate goal? To irreparably damage the “special relationship” between the two nations.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

8. The Deceivers (1988)

The Deceivers, “ a thrilling 1988 adventure-drama, unravels the hidden secrets of a shadowy society in British India. Set in 1825, the film follows the daring exploits of a man who risked his life to expose this lethal network of murderers.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

9. Taffin (1988)

Taffin”, a 1988 thrilling action-packed movie featuring Pierce Brosnan, Ray McAnally, and Alison Doody, focuses on an Irish debt collector, Taffin, who gets entangled in a precarious situation. Asked by his local community, Taffin is required to help in ridding their town of ruthless developers who aim to build a chemical plant on the outskirts of town. These developers are relentless, and their ruthless enforcers have been sent to the town, aiming to maintain silence among the locals.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

10. The Heist (1989)

The Heist” is a 1989 drama and romance film where Pierce Brosnan, Tom Skerritt, and Wendy Hughes take the lead roles. Set in the backdrop of a racetrack, the film revolves around a framed con-man on a mission to exact revenge. With the racetrack as his battleground, he meticulously plans a heist that promises to be nothing less than enthralling.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

11. Mister Johnson (1990)

Mister Johnson (1990) tells the riveting tale of a local Nigerian man named Mister Johnson as he strives for equality within the British Colonial administration in 1923 Nigeria. The film offers a window into a bygone era of colonial rule, and the struggle for power, identity, and acceptance.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

12. Victim of Love (1991)

Victim of Love”, a 1991 thrilling drama, follows a psychiatrist, Dr. Susan Williams (JoBeth Williams), who is mysteriously drawn to her charismatic patient, Charles McMurphy (Pierce Brosnan). The pair become emotionally entangled, further complicated by the revelation that Charles has a potentially dangerous past. As the moody atmosphere begins to swirl around them, questions arise about the man they both love — could he be a murderer?

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

13. Murder 101 (1991)

Murder 101, “ a 1991 mystery-thriller film directed by Bill Condon and written by Condon and Roy Johansen, stars Pierce Brosnan, Dey Young, and Antoni Corone. The film centers around Charles, a writer who pens a novel based on a real-life murder case. After achieving a successful book, Charles returns to his college to teach creative writing, where he challenges his students to write about planning a perfect murder.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

14. Live Wire (1992)

Live Wire” is a gripping action thriller from 1992, directed by Christian Duguay and written by Bart Baker. Pierce Brosnan, Ron Silver, and Ben Cross star in this tense tale of terror.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

15. The Lawnmower Man (1992)

Meet Chris, a simple man with an unfortunate fate — Chris is confined to a wheelchair and shunned by others due to his mental capabilities. But when a benevolent artificial intelligence expert offers him the chance for a better life, Chris is given the opportunity of a lifetime.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

16. Mrs. Doubtfire (1993)

Mrs. Doubtfire is a heartwarming comedy-drama released in 1993, starring the talented Robin Williams and directed by Chris Columbus.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

17. Entangled (1993)

In “Entangled, “ Judd Nelson and Pierce Brosnan star as David and Annabelle, a couple caught in a web of secrets, lies, and deceit that leads to a tragic accident. As the plot unravels, it becomes clear that their relationship is far from idyllic, with each character hiding dangerous secrets from the other.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

18. Detonator (1993)

Prepare for a heart-stopping experience with “Detonator” (1993), also known as “Death Train. “ Set in 1990s Bremen, Germany, this gripping thriller follows a train carrying high-profile hostages, along with a nuclear bomb, as it embarks on a dangerous journey through Europe. The fate of the continent now lies in the hands of a United Nations crime-fighting task force, led by international superstars Pierce Brosnan and Patrick Stewart.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

19. The Broken Chain (1993)

The Broken Chain, “ a 1993 war drama film, follows the story of two Iroquois brothers entangled in the chaos of the Revolutionary War. Directed by Lamont Johnson and written by Earl W. Wallace, this gripping tale brings to life the intense battles, combat, and hand-to-hand combat faced by the brothers during an era of conflict.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

20. Love Affair (1994)

Love Affair, released in 1994 and starring Warren Beatty and Annette Bening, tells the story of two people, both with fiancés, who meet on a plane bound for Sydney. When tragedy strikes and they’re forced into a makeshift evacuation, they find themselves falling for each other amidst the chaos.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

21. Don’t Talk to Strangers (1994)

Don’t Talk to Strangers” is a chilling crime thriller released in 1994, directed by Robert Michael Lewis and starring Pierce Brosnan, Shanna Reed, and Terry O’Quinn. The film revolves around a woman named Jane (played by Reed) who, after her first marriage falls apart, decides to start anew with her husband Patrick Brody (Brosnan) and move to a new state. However, her past refuses to stay behind when her vengeful ex-husband tracks them down to seek retribution.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

22. GoldenEye (1995)

GoldenEye, released in 1995, is the 16th film in the official James Bond series and the first to star Pierce Brosnan as the iconic British secret service agent. Directed by Martin Campbell and based on the novel by Ian Fleming, the movie centers around a secret space-based weapons program known as “GoldenEye, “ which has been stolen and is now in the hands of a Russian crime syndicate.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

23. Detonator II: Night Watch (1995)

In the high-stakes thriller “Detonator II: Night Watch, “ UN agents Mike and Sabrina find themselves entangled in a dangerous mission to uncover a sinister plot involving fake Rembrandt paintings and deadly North Korean bombs. As they delve deeper into the mystery, they must navigate through the complex streets of Amsterdam and Hong Kong in a race against time.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

24. Mars Attacks! (1996)

In this extraterrestrial invasion comedy, Tim Burton brings us “Mars Attacks! “ (1996). An amusing parody of “B” movie sci-fi, this dark comedy features Earth being attacked by malevolent Martians with a twisted sense of humor and unbeatable weaponry. Jack Nicholson, Pierce Brosnan, and Sarah Jessica Parker lead the star-studded cast in a humorous take on political satire.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

25. The Disappearance of Kevin Johnson (1996)

The Disappearance of Kevin Johnson” is a 1996 comedy film directed by Francis Megahy and written by Megahy and Robert Knott. Starring Pierce Brosnan, James Coburn, and Dudley Moore, this mockumentary follows the unexplained disappearance of an up-and-coming movie producer. Presented with a satirical twist, the film takes a humorous approach to the mystery surrounding the sudden disappearance of Kevin Johnson.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

26. The Mirror Has Two Faces (1996)

The Mirror Has Two Faces is a unique romantic comedy-drama from 1996, directed and starring Barbra Streisand. This film, the remake of a French film, follows the story of a middle-aged professor, played by Jeff Bridges, who embarks on a non-physical romantic relationship with his colleague, portrayed by Barbra Streisand. Their journey is filled with humor, drama, and raw emotions, testing their boundaries and pushing the limits.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

27. Dante’s Peak (1997)

Experience the heart-pounding thrill of Dante’s Peak, a captivating 1997 film that showcases the raw power of nature and the resilience of the human spirit. Pierce Brosnan, Linda Hamilton, and Jamie Renée Smith star in this action-packed, edge-of-your-seat adventure set in a quaint American town, recently named the second-most desirable place to live. However, beneath the idyllic surface lies a dormant volcano, Dante’s Peak, long believed to be inactive. That is until a dedicated volcanologist, played by Pierce Brosnan, arrives and discovers the truth — a colossal volcanic eruption is imminent, threatening the lives of the townspeople.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

28. Robinson Crusoe (1997)

Robinson Crusoe” is a gripping 1997 adventure drama film based on the classic novel by Daniel Defoe. Directed by Rod Hardy and George Miller, and starring Pierce Brosnan, this tale takes an unexpected turn when Crusoe, played by Brosnan, finds himself as the sole survivor of a shipwrecked vessel, left stranded on a mysterious island.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

29. Tomorrow Never Dies (1997)

Tomorrow Never Dies, “ a riveting Action, Adventure, and Thriller film, sees James Bond take on a media tycoon’s sinister plan to generate a war between China and the UK. The film’s climax revolves around seeking exclusive global media coverage. Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce, and Michelle Yeoh star in this adrenaline-packed movie, which, in 1997, premiered under the guidance of director Roger Spottiswoode and screenplay written by Bruce Feirstein and Ian Fleming.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

30. Quest for Camelot (1998)

Quest for Camelot, a delightful animated adventure, follows the journey of a gutsy girl, a witty hermit, and a comical two-headed dragon as they team up to search for the enigmatic Excalibur, the legendary lost sword of King Arthur. As the city of Camelot stands on the brink of ruin, the trio’s quest, full of humor, thrill, and heartfelt camaraderie, may hold the key to restoring the kingdom and saving its beloved leader. Filled with vibrant colors, captivating animation, and memorable characters, this movie is a fun-filled ride for all ages.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

31. The Nephew (1998)

The Nephew” is a heartfelt drama set on a small island off the coast of Ireland. The film explores an old conflict between two African American characters and their struggle to maintain harmony in the community.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

32. The World Is Not Enough (1999)

Experience the high-stakes thrill of action and adventure in “The World Is Not Enough, “ the 1999 James Bond film starring Pierce Brosnan, Sophie Marceau, and Robert Carlyle. When the world’s most sophisticated spy, 007, gets tangled in a deadly nuclear plot, he must protect an oil heiress from her kidnapper — an international terrorist who feels no pain.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

33. The Thomas Crown Affair (1999)

The Thomas Crown Affair, released in 1999, is a crime thriller that explores the cat-and-mouse game between a rich and charming playboy, played by Pierce Brosnan, who indulges in stealing artworks, and a seductive detective, portrayed by Rene Russo, who has taken it upon herself to uncover him. The movie weaves together romantic themes and suspenseful action sequences as the two leads engage in a high-stakes game of trust and deception. With a runtime of 1 hour and 53 minutes, this thrilling film delivers an exciting ride with its sharp wit and stylish execution.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

34. Grey Owl (1999)

Grey Owl, “ directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Pierce Brosnan, weaves a tale of transformation and dedication to the earth. This film takes you on an extraordinary journey into the life of a Canadian fur trapper who becomes a committed conservationist, all while claiming to be an aboriginal North American. Based on true events, the movie captivates audiences with its blend of drama, biography, and western elements, offering a mesmerizing portrayal of one man’s relentless pursuit of a greener world.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

35. The Match (1999)

The Match” is a delightful 1999 sports comedy film that centers around two Scottish pub football teams. Set in the heart of Scotland, the movie brings to life the friendly rivalry and deep-rooted camaraderie between the teams. The plot revolves around a century-old grudge that is resolved through an epic match between the two teams. The winning team will receive the other team’s pub, adding a unique twist to the competition.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

36. The Tailor of Panama (2001)

The Tailor of Panama” is a thrilling drama film directed by John Boorman and written by John le Carré, Andrew Davies, and John Boorman. The movie, released in 2001, stars Pierce Brosnan, Geoffrey Rush, and Jamie Lee Curtis.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

37. Evelyn (2002)

Evelyn” is an emotional drama set in the 1950s that tells the heart-wrenching story of Desmond, an unemployed father in Dublin, and his desperate attempt to reclaim his family after his wife abruptly leaves them. As authorities take his three children away and place them in orphanages, Desmond struggles to find a job and regain custody of his kids.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

38. Die Another Day (2002)

In “Die Another Day”, James Bond is tasked with unraveling a sinister connection between a North Korean terrorist and a wealthy diamond mogul who’s financing the development of a global space weapon. As Bond embarks on this action-packed adventure, he finds himself in the icy landscapes of Iceland, where he’s introduced to thrilling gadgets, including an exceptional gadget car.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

39. James Bond: A BAFTA Tribute (2002)

Experience the epic world of James Bond like never before in “James Bond: A BAFTA Tribute” (2002), a captivating celebration of the iconic film series’ 40-year legacy. Hosted by renowned television personality Michael Parkinson, this engaging TV special takes viewers on a journey through the dynamic history of the 007 franchise. From breathtaking stunts and ingenious gadgetry to iconic music and design, the tribute pays homage to the remarkable talent behind the movies.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

40. Best Ever Bond (2002)

In “Best Ever Bond, “ a star-studded cast, including Roger Moore himself, takes viewers on a thrilling journey through the most memorable scenes in the James Bond series. From high-stakes action sequences to heart-pounding adventures, this documentary offers an exclusive behind-the-scenes look at iconic moments that have shaped the legendary franchise. Narrated by the inimitable Roger Moore, “Best Ever Bond” not only showcases the best of the best but also lets fans relive cherished scenes while hearing directly from the talented cast members who brought them to life.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

41. Deep Blue (2003)

Deep Blue” is a mesmerizing documentary that takes viewers on a captivating journey through the underwater world — a realm where humans rarely dare to tread. The film offers an awe-inspiring exploration of marine wildlife and breathtaking underwater scenes.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

42. The Kennedy Center Honors: A Celebration of the Performing Arts (2003)

Experience a mesmerizing celebration of the performing arts in the enchanting film, “The Kennedy Center Honors: A Celebration of the Performing Arts”. Released in 2003, this unforgettable musical event boasts a stellar cast, including the inimitable James Brown and the captivating Carol Burnett, among others. This heartwarming family film, directed by Louis J. Horvitz, highlights the importance of honoring those who have made unforgettable contributions to the world of performing arts.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

43. 9th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards (2003)

Experience the glamour and excitement of the 9th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards in this remarkable TV special. The event, hosted by renowned director Ron de Moraes, spotlights the American Awards presented by the esteemed Guild of movie actors for exceptional performances in both movies and television serials, dating back to 1995.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

44. Christmas from Hollywood (2003)

Get ready for a heartwarming journey through the world of Hollywood and Christmas with the captivating film, “Christmas from Hollywood” (2003). This 1-hour, 12-minute documentary takes viewers on an enchanting ride through the magical history of Hollywood Christmas celebrations.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

45. Inside ‘Die Another Day’ (2003)

Inside ‘Die Another Day’ takes viewers behind the scenes of the 20th James Bond film, marking the 40th anniversary of the iconic 007 franchise. This documentary offers an exclusive glimpse into the creation of the most modern, high-tech world ever seen in a Bond film. Shot on location and featuring interviews with key crew members, this short film showcases the movie’s connections to the title and the shooting of various action sequences, providing fans with a unique and insightful look into the making of a James Bond classic.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

46. After the Sunset (2004)

After the Sunset” is a thrilling adventure where master thief Max (Pierce Brosnan) and his sultry accomplice Lola (Salma Hayek) successfully pull off one last heist. As the F. B. I. Agent, Claude (Woody Harrelson), gets closer to capturing him, Max and Lola find themselves tangled in a dangerous game of cat and mouse.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

47. Laws of Attraction (2004)

Laws of Attraction” is a delightful neo-screwball comedy that follows the budding romance between two high-powered divorce lawyers, played by Pierce Brosnan and Julianne Moore, amidst a sea of litigation in New York City. As they navigate the complexities of their careers, they also find themselves navigating the unpredictable and often hilarious world of workplace romance. With engaging performances, the film explores the challenges and thrills of using others, love, and finding unexpected connections in the most unexpected places.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

48. The 76th Annual Academy Awards (2004)

The 76th Annual Academy Awards, also known as the Oscars, is a prestigious annual event where the film industry comes together to celebrate cinematic achievements of the previous year. The 2004 ceremony showcases a range of nominated films, including epic masterpiece “The Return of the King, “ the poignant drama “Lost in Translation, “ the historical epic “Master and Commander, “ the gripping crime-thriller “Mystic River, “ and the heartwarming sports story “Seabiscuit. “ The event, hosted by the talented Billy Crystal, is renowned for its live performances, humorous moments, and heartwarming tributes to the film industry. This Academy Awards ceremony, held in 2004, demonstrates the extraordinary talents and contributions of the film industry in the 2000s, with a remarkable lineup of nominees and an unforgettable night of celebration.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

49. Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell — Volume 2 (2004)

Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell — Volume 2 is a hilarious compilation of the best moments from Will Ferrell’s illustrious SNL career. With a runtime of 1 hour and 22 minutes, this comedy retrospective presents iconic sketches, including Janet Reno’s Dance Party, The Lovers, James Lipton’s “Inside the Actor’s Studio, “ Wake Up and Smile, and the ever-popular Bill Brasky, along with many more.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

50. The Matador (2005)

Enter a world where danger and deception collide, and an unexpected bond is forged. In “The Matador” (2005), a globe-trotting hitman and a despondent businessman meet at a hotel bar in Mexico City, setting the stage for a serendipitous encounter that will change their lives. As they unravel secrets, flirt with temptation, and grapple with the lines between right and wrong, a thrilling journey of crime and comedy unfolds.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

51. The 77th Annual Academy Awards (2005)

Witness the glamour, excitement, and prestige of The 77th Annual Academy Awards, where the best of the film industry comes together to celebrate excellence in cinema. Hosted by the charismatic Chris Rock, the ceremony nominates critically acclaimed films such as The Aviator, Finding Neverland, Million Dollar Baby, Ray, and Sideways for prestigious awards.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

52. Boffo! Tinseltown’s Bombs and Blockbusters (2006)

Dive into the heart of Tinseltown with “Boffo! . Tinseltown’s Bombs and Blockbusters” (2006), a compelling documentary that puts Hollywood’s leading lights under the microscope to unravel the secrets behind blockbusters, flops and movie magic.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

53. Whaledreamers (2006)

In the heart of Australia, an Aboriginal tribe stands on the brink of cultural extinction. Whaledreamers documents the resilience of this ancient community as they seek to reconnect with their deepest traditions and the oceans that give life. Through the journeys of Whales and humans alike, the film explores the power of healing, the importance of unity, and the enduring spirit of hope.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

54. Seraphim Falls (2006)

Set in the shadow of Seraphim Falls, this movie explores the complexities of the post-Civil War era as a former Confederate colonel, desperate to avenge a personal loss, embarks on a deadly hunt for a former Yankee officer. An action-packed drama filled with gripping thrills, Seraphim Falls takes viewers on a relentless pursuit that tests both the hunter and the hunted. With compelling performances by Pierce Brosnan, Liam Neeson and Anjelica Huston, this suspenseful movie will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

55. Stephen Fry: The Secret Life of the Manic Depressive (2006)

Stephen Fry: The Secret Life of the Manic Depressive” is a captivating documentary produced in 2006, exploring the little-understood and potentially devastating world of manic depression, affecting an estimated two percent of the population. The movie, presented by the renowned British actor and comedian Stephen Fry, takes viewers on a highly-emotional journey as he interacts with fellow sufferers and experts. The film delves deep into the reality of living with bipolar disorder, revealing the literal highs and lows that come with it.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

56. The Fifa 2006 World Cup Film: The Grand Finale (2006)

The Fifa 2006 World Cup Film: The Grand Finale is a thrilling documentary that takes viewers on an unforgettable journey through the Germany 2006 World Cup. Narrated by the suave and charismatic Pierce Brosnan, this definitive film captures the nail-biting moments, exciting goals, and heart-stopping thrills that made the tournament a truly memorable event.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

57. Happy Birthday Elton! From Madison Square Garden, New York (2007)

Happy Birthday Elton! From Madison Square Garden, New York” captures the essence of an iconic moment in history. In a celebration of Elton John’s 60th birthday, the musician performs an impressive 60th sold-out show at the iconic Madison Square Garden. The event features an array of celebrity appearances, including some of the world’s most recognized names, such as Whoopi Goldberg, President Bill Clinton, and Robin Williams.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

58. Married Life (2007)

Married Life” is a captivating 1940s drama where an adulterous man plots his wife’s demise rather than subjecting her to the public humiliation of a divorce. As our protagonist, played by Chris Cooper, finds himself entangled in a web of infidelity and deceit, he is faced with a morally ambiguous decision that sets the stage for a heart-pounding tale of crime and love.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

59. Shattered (2007)

Shattered, “ the intense crime drama directed by Mike Barker, follows the unexpected unraveling of the perfect family. A mysterious stranger enters the picture with a chilling and brutally efficient kidnapping plot, threatening the family’s dynamic.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

60. Mamma Mia! (2008)

Mamma Mia! . is a delightful musical comedy that takes audiences on a joyful journey to an idyllic Greek island, where a bride-to-be named Sophie embarks on a quest to discover her true father’s identity. Packed with irresistible ABBA hits that take center stage, the film unfolds with lively laughter and heartwarming romance.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

61. Oceans (2009)

Oceans, directed by Jacques Perrin and Jacques Cluzaud, is a gripping documentary film that combines the thrills of ecological drama with a poignant meditation on the dwindling wonders of the ocean depths. Filmed at stunning locations worldwide, this breathtaking exploration of diverse marine life covers the majestic sharks, the curious pufferfish, and even the humble sea turtle.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

62. The Greatest (2009)

The Greatest” (2009) is a poignant drama that tells the story of a young family trying to heal after the heartbreaking loss of their son, while also grappling with their daughter’s struggles as she embraces motherhood. Directed by Shana Feste and featuring a stellar cast, including Carey Mulligan, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, and Pierce Brosnan, the film delves into the complexities of family and the painful bonds that unite us. With mature themes of substance abuse, love, and loss, this gripping drama explores the emotional journey of a family and the sacrifices they must make to preserve their future.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

63. Remember Me (2010)

Remember Me” is a poignant romance drama, released in 2010, starring Robert Pattinson and Emilie de Ravin. This film, titled “Remember Me, “ is an intense exploration of two young lovers, Tyler and Ally, bound together by their past.
